Reviews.Title: “Good customer service / Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rrlovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were pretty road weary upon arrival due to trying to navigate our way into the hotel through the gated community. The staff graciously showed us to our standard room which was a total dump. It was a $40/a night kind of room not a $115/a night room. Their were mosquitos EVERYWHERE probably about 50 of them in a 10 x 14 space. I asked the front desk to change rooms because I am very allergic to mosquitos. He was actually very nice and put us in a larger room on the ocean side. He gave us a mosquito repeller and we killed about 40 mosquitos that were in that room. Also the bathroom toilet was leaking all over the floor and the room was still run down. I notice they were hyping the property for weddings and I know if it was me I would be upset to book a wedding at that property. I will say that the hotel staff was very nice but it just can't make up for how poor the rooms are. I think they have all those mosquitos because of the plumbing problems? Just saying.

Reviews.Title: “Storm of a wedding.”
Reviews.Author: Margie D
Reviews.Content: I came here for a friends wedding. The rooms were nothing like she saw on the computer. Also the wedding couple booked an adjoining room for their children. When we checked in the rooms were not adjoining. More often we had no water, let alone hot water. 21 family and friends came from New Jersey for her wedding. We were all upset with the accommendations. When ever asked to speak to the owner she was no where to be found. The room her wedding was in, was filthy. We were cleaning the day before the wedding. Finally when the bride complained the staff did clean the room. The dinner was choosen well before we got there and the day of the wedding there was no chicken (only 3 people ordered that). A staff member announced it to me and I informed her to speak to the bride and groom. They were served pasta and burgers ( at $60.00 a plate ) The hotel could be very nice if the owner took pride. The staff was wonderful! I would never stay here again nor recommend anyone to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable with a great beach location”
Reviews.Author: rolncathy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed here one night, prior to flying home, but could have happily stayed longer. It is the real Puerto Rico, not a 5 star chain hotel! The staff was great! They held our luggage when we arrived early and our room was not ready and again when we had a late afternoon flight and planned an excursion into Old San Juan. before flying home. They gave us clear directions when we couldn't find out how to get into the gated community. We were able to take the bus in to Old San Juan and back to the hotel with their help. Unlike an earlier report, we saw no more than the normal police presence and walked to and from the bus stops, picked up an ice cream at the mini-mart near the entrance to the community and ate at an unusual little local restaurant called Pizza Cono which served a pizza in a cone across from the mini-mart. After staying in several places in Puerto Rico and wanting to continue to see the real Puerto Rico, the one that people who live there see every day, we were not bothered by rust (they are along a saltwater beach!), heat and humidity, brick buildings (which might stand up to a hurricane).... If you want an American experience stay at an American chain. We will take good customer service and a great location any day. That is not to say there were not things that could have been attended to. I have been in expensive hotels with wallpaper peeling, or cereal bits on the floor that had not been cleaned up prior to our arrival. It happens. Water pressure and sewer problems occur all over the island, we saw our share. We had read that parking was a problem, as in "no parking available" so we turned in our rental car, rode the local bus and took a taxi (which the hotel called for us) to the airport. By the way, our bed was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT stay here”
Reviews.Author: volvo850t
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week last month, and I was surpriced by the false FREE parking on weekends!! There is NO free parking, the rooms are small and stuffy, and the beds old and hard. The WIFI doesn't work due to the building made out of brick. The cheap A/C unit leak water into the room, and it seems that the bar employees have an attitude, the lady at the front office was NOT courteous at all...... I would never stay at this place again ever!

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: josersanta
Reviews.Content: First and last time I stay here. First time I come to Puerto Rico I selected this hotel promote it self has beautiful hotel and location at internet and saw the pictures on there website there very nice at the time..... but we check in totally did opposite the rooms and hotel dont look nothing has adv on there website hotel look dirty and need some serious repairs and cleanning at end we checkout 2nd day!

Reviews.Title: “SHORT STAY”
Reviews.Author: manuel b
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place to relax,and the people in the hotel is friendly and they apreciate your stay and visit their hotel and Puerto Rico, I work all around the island and stay in this hotel and the service of people specially Edgardo and Viviane.make the diference and you decide to return again to enjoy of this hotel and the people....many thanks for your attention Edgardo and Viviane.See you soon

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveler53719
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here one night before flying out early in the morning (its a couple of miles from the airport). Over all I really liked this hotel and would stay again. Pros Very cute, small Caribbean style hotel. Friendly and helpful staff - Thanks for all your help John. Bilingual staff (English and Spanish) On the beach - literally just a step off restaurant and bar Nice lobby Secure - its located in a gated community Good food at the restaurant - all four of us liked our dinner items (chowder, Sea food fettuccine, mahi-mahi, a hamburger and salmon ceviche for an appetizer). Some rooms come with great ocean views/balcony (we loved sitting out there) Beautiful,clean beach (we noticed they came by at dark and collected trash bins) Restaurant had the option to serve meals on the beach (tables set out on the sand). Rooms were neat and clean (yes, some sand gets in from the beach). Relatively close to the airport, though Isla Verde region is a little closer. We did not swim in the ocean but it looked to be a swimming beach with very small waves. A/C available in the rooms. Cons The neighborhood surrounding the gated community was pretty seedy - personally I would not leave the gated area. We saw a large police presence - to prevent crime I presume. Unfortunately this leaves you a bit stranded unless you take a taxi to other locations. The area with in the gated community was very nice. We noticed helicopter police scanning the beaches after dark and police boats patrolling during the day. We did not feel unsafe on the beach or at the hotel at all. We noticed a police presence near Old San Juan and Isla Verde as well, but not as much. There is no parking garage, we got lucky and found a place on the street. This place would be best for someone who plans on taking a taxi in and out. It's not too far from Old San Juan - maybe 3-4 miles. The building is concrete but the doors are wood with slates so we had some noise from neighbors who came in late. Its a small place so not lots of coming and going but if noise bothers you I would request a room without an adjoining door (to another room) and away from as much foot traffic as possible. Infrastructure. All older buildings in Puerto Rico seem to have water pressure and sewage issues. We stayed at three places in different parts of the island and all had issues with water pressure, lack of water, drainage (don't flush toilet paper down toilets). This place requested no toilet paper in toilet and had intermittent water pressure issues. Price: while we really enjoyed the food and bar services, paying approximately $25-30/meal would get tiring if we were staying for an extended time. The beach extended a long ways down from the hotel in both directions, perhaps walking down the beach would have yielded additional food/bar options. Rooms are a little small but with the balcony space was ample for the 4 of us. Lastly, the hotel is a little bit hard to find. It's a few blocks off of Loiza Ave, but the road sign is missing and you have to come in a different way anyway since it's gated. Just ask the hotel for directions before arriving if you are driving.

Reviews.Title: “Depends upon what you wish to do in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: redneckerson5
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Ocean View, a large controll access area on the north shore. We (and another couple) stayed two nights prior to a cruise to the Souther Caribbean. An evaluation of the hotel for anyone requires decideing what matters most to you. On the plus side you have a location directly on the beach at a reasonable price, a very friendly helpful staff, and a good restaurant with a plesant bar area. Rooms vary in size, but some have beach access. Our was small with only a dresser, flat screen TV, tow end tables and a quee sized bed. The floor was concrete. The mattress, while comfortable sagged in sthe middle. On the negative side is location and noise. Getting to places other than the beach requires a $10 - 15 (each way) taxi ride. Dedicated walkers may find sufficient attractions within a 45-50 minute walk, but the primary tourist sites are not realistically walkable (NOTE: we prefer walking when possible). As to oise, the rooms are not well insulated. The short interior hall served as a megaphone. NOt only could we clearly hear other guests going to their rooms, but conversations in the lobby were clearly audible. Nose also came from the backside of the room which faced a courtyeard. In fairness, we shared the hotel with a large wedding party that celebrated into the early hours of each morning. On balance, if the beach is the primary reason for your visit, this hotel would be a good choice. Otherwise, consider carefullly the negatives of the location against the exellent price.

Reviews.Title: “This is the place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: VeneUsa
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Hosteria del Mar is that it is located away from the city craziness! The staff has been amazing! Their kindness has been present since day one. We were fortunate to get amazing upgrades by Hector, Edgardo and Gladys! OMG they were really helpful and supportive! They made sure we had the best Spring Break ever!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip of my life!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: John1335
Reviews.Content: My first trip to puerto rico and i must say i absolutely loved my stay at the hotel, the food at the restaurant was AMAZING!!! The service was great and the employees were really friendly :D The room was cozy and my bed was huge and comfy ooh and the sound of the waves at night was soothing after a long day at the beach. During my third day i had a slight problem, but the manager personally took care of it. I really enjoyed my stay and i would surely recommend this hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico rip off”
Reviews.Author: kimbo-travels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after leaving our wonderful cruise. I would suggest that all people take heed to the negative reviews. #1- not only no hot water but no water at all for the shower. All 3 people staying in this room at different times attempted to shower but none were successful. #2- The dinner menu was expensive for what you got and the food was mediocre at best.( we felt totally ripped off due to the size of the portions and the quality of the food) #3- Noise, they put us in a room directly below a wedding bash, music was blaring and there was NO glass in the windows we couldn't hear the t.v. without turning up the volume to full blast.( I eventually complained and the party shut down at about 11:00pm. #4- $170 per night read my credit card statement when I arrived home and they charged $10 for resort fees?? We didn't use a beach towel, we didn't use anything at all except our room. I also had a charge of over $6 for a small bottle water that my daughter drank even though it clearly stated they were $3. |#5- We travel extensively and hands down this is the worse place I have stayed in years, if you like old, run down, expensive, rip off's stay here you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: teresa w
Reviews.Content: No vent in Bathroom, Outlets not working, television not working, no room service bathroom curtains missing, Food Horrible, The room felt very damp, we had to ask for the room to be cleaned, the telephone did not work at all. This was my first trip to Puerto Rico and my stay was very bad could not wait to leave, the place needs an upgrade badly did not worth the money spent. Thank you for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “False online advertisement”
Reviews.Author: Victor_herzberg
Reviews.Content: From now on I will always read carefully reviews before committing to a hotel. For this particular hotel, I had not expected such a six day nightmare...It is true that a location in the front of the ocean should be magnificent... But when you have dirty windows that barely protects you from the wind and its whistle through them and you have to compete with other guests for a chaise lounge on the beach, you end up quite disappointed. I felt trapped in that bad Clorox smelling room, when a very noisy function was taking place just one floor above. Outside it was raining and inside it was impossible to relax because the loud drums. The restaurant is windy when weather is not clement, and not very comfortable to stay too long time. While romantic at night, it is boring to wait so long for the waiter to assist you for whatsoever. They seem to forget about you, and are absorbed in other duties, even if you are the only one client. But the restaurant is what they have the best. And perhaps the neighborhood which is worthwile for a stroll, when you have no place to sit on the beach or you get pissed off by the poor conditions in the room. One day I discovered that the housekeeper forgot to lock the dorr of my room, after she had finished the cleaning of it. I got concerned, because the safe in the room is just a toy, not a real safe, not functional by size and by the impossibility to lock/ unlock, rusted and outdated. Despite the total price of 300$/day, The room was not provided with many expected items like hangers in the closets, hairdryer that functionned, even a glass to drink the few beverages left for client to buy at 5$/ can if thirsty. And, most surprising, no phone in a room at this price! The fact that the water pressure and the hot water in the shower was a problem, it did not upset me as much as the fact that there were not signes for hot/cold on the two faucets and one of the faucets was rotating with no limit, making you disorientd about how could you find some warm water to shower, beside having to wait for it. The " eco friendly" attitude should not be a pretext for getting a bigger profit for the business by spending less investment and time to check the rooms for what they need. On windy days there is a continuous whistle in the room made by the wind and due to the windows which do not close well because outdated and the door that has woody blinds, permissive for the draft from the open air commun hallway. Staff is always smiley, but when they were asked to come with me in the room to instruct me how could I be able to take a warm shower after 2 days of cold ones, I told them bitterly that one cannot run a businees with a smile only, you should provide customers with something more than your precious smile, if you want them to come again or to recommend the place to others. The woman owner was also only smiles, but it took me effort to respond with a smile, because I was unhappy with the stay. Like never before, we were inpatients to arrive back home for once. There are about 6 chaise lounges for which we competed every morning, that were in good shape. The guests willing to sun bath outnumbered by far these few chaise lounges

Reviews.Title: “Great value great location”
Reviews.Author: r c
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Puerto Rico, and I was in need of a low-key place to rest, relax and enjoy the weather. Overall, I was very pleased with Hosteria Del Mar. The new owners have put a lot of work into the facility, which I understand was pretty run down when they bought it a few years ago. Their on-site restaurant, Uvva, could compete favorably with some of the best on the island. The accommodations, while not squeaky clean, were more than adequate and very comfortable, athough the showers took time to regulate due to the solar heated hot water (keep the solar panels clean). All the staff people that I met and dealt with - John, Maria, Hector, Dimas, Edgardo, Gladys, to name a few - were just wonderful and genuinely nice people. I would not hesitate for a minute to return. This will soon no longer be the best kept secret on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy spot... one of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: PRSimmondsOhio
Reviews.Content: I was born and raised in Puerto Rico, so when I go back I want to feel like home. Hosteria del Mar have a great location, away from the crowd and just right on the beach. Even when I used to live in Puerto Rico, going to the hotel restaurant UVVA, sit on the deck and have a nice dinner, while listening to the sound of the waves, was one of my favorite things to do. With that being said, the true is the property needs some improvements and remodelings (and I heard they are working on it). If you are looking for luxury, this is not the place. However, if you are looking for a cozy place to relax, with good service and great view, right on the beach, this is a place you should consider. Staff is friendly and helpful. My husband and I enjoy our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Laid back beach vibe”
Reviews.Author: MissBeachy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a group for two nights after a cruise. If you are looking for something fancy go somewhere else. If you enjoy a rustic beachy enviroment I recommend. Our stay was enjoyable, as we liked the relaxed vibe and the staff was very friendly and accomadating. Rooms were large. My only dislike was that the rooms could have been a little cleaner and the shower was terrible. Great location on the beach and excellent bakery within walking distance. The restraunt was fairly good, we enjoyed the burgers for lunch. Very romatintic dining for in the evening. The people at the front desk were great! All requests met.

Reviews.Title: “Complete False advertisement”
Reviews.Author: Newmarkethotmama
Reviews.Content: I arrived in Puerto Rico thinking that my self and my famly would be staying in a beautiful beachfront property. Well was I mistaken. Nothing about this property was as it is online. We stayed one night and left the next morning.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite small hotel in the San Juan metro area.”
Reviews.Author: Tjohnangle
Reviews.Content: This is my fourth time staying at the hosteria. It has grown a lot since my first trip in 2005, but always in a good direction. As always, the staff was exceedingly friendly and helpful. Even though we arrived (very tired after our 6am flight) and a bit before our rooms were supposed to be ready, Edgardo at the front desk shuffled some things around and got us into another ocean view room. Thanks so much!

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Find”
Reviews.Author: Patricia M
Reviews.Content: Older, charming, clean, hotel right on the beach in Condado Beach. Excellent for a relaxing get away. The Ocean Front Views are a must - with balconies you can still feel like you are on the beach without the sun burn. This is our second time there - we will go again!

Reviews.Title: “Polished faÃ§ade but needs significant improvement”
Reviews.Author: RMRK1
Reviews.Content: This little place has an amazing location, situated in a quiet gated community away from the standard tourist areas. The dÃ©cor in the common areas has obviously been updated recently and looks great. Unfortunately, one merely needs to look beyond the polished faÃ§ade to see that there is need for a lot of improvement here. The best feature of our room was its incredible view from the private balcony. Otherwise, it was in serious need of general maintenance. All of the doors and windows had outdated, rusted mechanisms making unlocking, opening, and closing exceedingly difficult. On two occasions we needed help from housekeeping to get our room door open. The tiny, ancient safe in the closet was not big enough for the smallest of laptops and was nearly impossible to open and close. Half of the electrical outlets in the room were not working, including the one powering one of the bedside reading lamps. Only one of the two overhead lights in the room worked. One outlet in the closet was hanging loose in the wall with no cover, looking very dangerous for anyone with children. The towel rack in the bathroom was loose and drooping and the shower curtain rod would come crashing down with the slightest touch. There was some sort of hole in the ceiling above the bed packed with what appeared to be a wad of facial tissue and some random wood or a food wrapper. There was hardly ever any water pressure in the shower and fleeting hot/warm water. Most days the shower at full pressure gave just a trickle. The sink in the kitchenette had no hot water at all, not even a trickle. Located directly on the beach, it is no surprise the rooms eventually accumulate a fair amount of sand on the floors. During our 6 days in the room, housekeeping never once swept the floors. By the end of our stay we could walk around the room and get nearly as much sand on our feet as walking on the beach. Worse yet, it seems they would just shake out the sheets rather than change them, so our bed accumulated sand throughout our stay as well. There was also no consistency in the availability of towels. We could count on having two bath towels; otherwise we got a hand towel for one day and a washcloth twice. The hotel provides only 10 beach lounge chairs for all of the guests, and only half or less of these are in full working order. Others have broken webbing, bent frames, malfunctioning legs, and one even had rusted metal wire sticking out. With so few chairs, the guests get competitive and go out early each day to â€œreserveâ€� chairs using towels or other items, and keep them that way for hours on end while away from the beach. The staff does nothing to stop this behavior. The restaurant downstairs is pretty and the staff is friendly. However, we found the service to be dreadfully slow. One night after finishing our meal we sat with empty plates and glasses for 15 minutes or more. Someone finally came over to ask if we needed anything else and we asked for the check. We waited 10 more minutes before a second person came over and asked if we needed anything. Again, we had to ask for the check. We tried eating there twice with similar experiences each time so vowed never again, opting instead for the plentiful dining alternatives in the nearby Condado area. This would be a great place with a little work: (1) Regular inspections and maintenance on the rooms. (2) Either fix the hot water/shower situation or warn guests ahead of time about the problem so they donâ€™t have unpleasant surprises. (3) Step up housekeeping efforts or at least provide each room with a broom so guests can clear away sand on their own if they want to. (4) Invest in new/more beach chairs. (5) Improve restaurant service.

Reviews.Title: “Unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: They were out of half the menu. We called ahead to make sure they were still serving brunch and were told that brunch was served from 11-4. When we arrived we were told that there was no brunch service. They had almost nothing on the menu, literally I tried to order 5 different dishes and they were out of each. The view is spectacular, but if you want to eat, SKIP IT!

Reviews.Title: “An intimate inn on a beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: barbaraandbill554
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at Hosteria del Mar, and have already booked a third one. This rustic inn, with about 15 rooms and several housekeeping apartments has a Hemingway feel to it. It sits on a beautiful beach, and boasts an extraordinary restaurant serving breakfast, lunch and dinner, either on the beach, on a deck overlooking the beach, or in an indoor dining room, where the wooden shuttered windows overlook the beach. The menu is creative and varied, and the service, both in the restaurant and the hotel is personal and caring. Edgardo Rosario, the concierge/manager is especially to be commended for his responsiveness to the details that made our stay outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “abysmal at best”
Reviews.Author: LaVern763
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of their apartments. The place smelled and probably had not been updated since it was built.The chairs were filthy dirty, the hide a bed was equally filthy. The bathroom hotwater did not even have running water. We asked to be moved and was denied. Expensive to a dilapitated horrible room The patio furniture was ripped and the lights outside the door were out. We ate at the restaurant and that was about the only good point and the location on the beach was great. AC was noisey. I would never ever stay there again nor ever recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beach -Boutique Hotel at its Best!- AB”
Reviews.Author: Alan B
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive... the first thing you hear is the sound of the water cascade fountain as you approach the lobby...very soothing and relax. Its like walking into your own little SPA. Great service at UVA (restaurant) where all the tables face the crystal white sand beach. I just recently relocated to San Juan for work....suddenly I find myself staying at the Hotel every weekend for the last three weeks. I really like the cleanliness and willingness to help from everyone that works at the hotel. Edgardo- Thanks for going the extra mile!.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: J V
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hosteria del Mar mainly because when I decide to call the lady that answer the phone sounded very charming and she really convinced me. When I got to the hotel I loved it.The lobby got all different Indian style furnishes. When I asked for Gladys (the lady who help me with my reservation by the phone) was the one in front desk, she was very charming indeed. She upgraded us to an ocean view and I was delighted the view is beautiful I fell in love with the place. My husband is from Puerto Rico but It was my first time in the Island and this hotel was a good pick. The food in the restaurant was delicious actually is one of the best places I ate in our stay. The only thing was that the waiting time was to much for the waiters to come to our table. We had a little problem with the water in our room but I can say that It was a real good stay and planing to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing weekend off the beaten path, but in the metropolitan area”
Reviews.Author: Robert K
Reviews.Content: Truly relaxing beach hotel, it is off the beaten path, at the end of a upper middle-class neighborhood street, service was good, room great, disconnect from worries immediate. Area has good restaurants and bakery within safe walking distance. Edgardo gave a us a room upgrade to beach view, an added plus. Good a/c.

Reviews.Title: “Island atmosphere in San Juan - Ocean Park”
Reviews.Author: erinsheff
Reviews.Content: It's right on the beach in a gated community, so it's safe to walk around the neighborhood, and your neighbors on the beach are upscale. The restaurant is expensive but delicious, although the entrees have too much food. You can just order the appetizers or split an entree, unless you want a double portion. The cocktails are outrageously expensive and phony, at least my Cosmo was. Ask for the cocktail menu before ordering. The front desk people are delightful - the waitstaff not so.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Bohemian Chic on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: Otono76
Reviews.Content: We had about half our guests stay here when we traveled to PR for our destination wedding. We didn't have the wedding here, but we hosted a few breakfasts and a happy hour while we were staying here. It was a great staging ground for all of our guests to gather in the beautiful beach front lounge and restaurant or hang out on the beach itself. If you are expecting a resort-like hotel, you will be disappointed. This is really more of a B&B atmosphere with a great location on the beach. But if you want something locally-owned, unique and low-key with a personality, then this is the place! The rooms in the front facing the water are tastefully renovated, but I would recommend avoiding the standard rooms and apartments in the back because they haven't been updated in a long time. What the property lacks in amenities, it makes up for in charm and friendliness. The staff is very fun and welcoming - especially Gladys, Edgardo and Dimas and the owners (a young husband and wife team) are extremely thoughtful and considerate. They personally went out of their way to make us feel at home during our week-long stay and helped us with a few last minute details. A few things that would improve this property: 1. consistent hot water (it tends to be tepid, which most of our friends who have traveled through the Caribbean say is not uncommon in smaller properties, but most of us were not used to this. However, the owners started installing extra solar panels the week we were there to increase more heat.) 2. Hardware - the doors and windows have old locks, handles, etc. which seem to stick and this detail aggravated a few people. 3. Service - depending on the day, the restaurant service, although very friendly, could be very off. All in all, we had a great stay here and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Management”
Reviews.Author: meye
Reviews.Content: My hotel experience in PR was not great but I loved PR. I am not a hotel snob and am giving this a 1 star because the room was not really clean and thought overall quality (bed, bed sheet) was very poor. I can deal with dated furniture but cleanliness is far too important for a good night's sleep. Phone in room did not function. Found it really strange that front desk kept one of the main doors that led from the rooms to lobby locked at night blocking access if you wanted to use internet. Made you wonder what kind of guests were staying there. As someone else posted a picture our room had one of those rusty chain locks. I understand PR has a lot of poverty but feel that you should be able to find cleaner, safer hotel than this. I would have given it a 2 star but the beach in front of the property was mediocre. I felt there are far better hotels with nicer beaches. PR has a lot to offer. Stay in a cleaner hotel with more happening neighborhood in San Juan if you want a more exciting vacation. This place was dead. The only pro was that restaurant/bar staff were friendly. The restaurant also has a great view of the ocean and you can get a table right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: aethomasthomas
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and it was wonderful. i wander if elsa and else are still here.if they are email me at aethomasthomas@netscape.net

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Marja S
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the bad reviews are about- we had a great time at Hosteria del Mar. The service was excellent and the facilities were quite nice. We had an ocean view room which was beautiful and the hotel is literally right on the beach. It's true that the rooms are a little "damp" because of the wind coming off of the ocean (its unpreventable unless you're in a big hotel resort where they advise you to keep the sealed doors closed to prevent this) but it wasn't a big problem. The restaurant was yummy, too :) The AC worked fine and it was relaxing to fall asleep to the sound of the ocean. Also, it's in a gated community, so it's in a good, safe location.

Reviews.Title: “Hosteria Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: LAG979
Reviews.Content: We checked into an ocean front room, it had a horrible moldy smell and it had water all over the floor to the point the bed skirts & curtains were soaked. The a/c was not working properly neither was the shower. We asked for another room and were told they were aware of the issue in the room. That seemed odd. We were then put in another room with the same smell, the toilet did not flush at all and there was no shower head on the shower. The windows were covered in salt from the salt air and you could barely see out of them. (I live on the beach and it is not difficult to keep your windows clean). I went back to the front desk to inform them of this room and they did not care at all. No offer to change to another room or even some type of refund. It was late so we stayed the night and left early as my allergies were bad from the room. I would NEVER recommend this hotel to anyone. The staff did not care about customer service at all.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience! Waste of money!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaRivera147322
Reviews.Content: (Take a look at the photos) We are really sad in writing this feedback but itâ€™s important to let people know in order to prevent them of having the waste of money of their life. We pay $180 to stay for 2 nights in a beachfront room. The room was small, smelly and the shower had only cold water. We complained about our need of hot water and the front desk lady told us that they had solar and electrical heating system and that they will check on that, which never happened because the next day another lady working at the front desk told us that the heating system was broke a LONG time ago, and that only a few rooms in the hotel had hot water. (They also told us that there was nothing they could do about). Later on we acknowledged that electric plugs didnâ€™t work either so there was no way of blow drying hair, recharging cell phones, etc. After complaining a third time for all the things that went wrong in our room, we asked to be moved on another one (expecting it to be as nice as the one we pay for). This one had hot water and electric plugs worked well, but the room and bathroom were dirty and in need of an overhaul. The fixtures in the bathroom were rusted, even the bathtub. Definitively they gave us one of the worst rooms after paying that much for a beach front room. It was also very noisy and dark because it was located in a hidden area of the hotel were the only view you got was a huge dirty wall. About the food we found it average. Waitress Maria was excellent and after knowing our entire situation, she took good care of us during dinner. There was no parking area. We had to park the car in the street and there was no security at all. We will never recommend this place. There are other more beautiful places to stay in the area of San Juan. If the hotel offers you to stay for $50-$60 per night, then go ahead and stay. The beachfront rooms are nicer but the whole experience was so bad that there is no way we want people to visit our island and live such a bad experience as we did. Itâ€™s saddest for us to have the worst experience by far in our own island. We like to travel a lot and this situation never happened before in any place weâ€™ve been. (LOOK AT THE PICTURES)

Reviews.Title: “great team work”
Reviews.Author: stephanie a
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place from which you enter the hospitality shown to start at the check in very friendly Edgardo take care of everything and take are bags very gently . gladys at night sweetness helped us to choose a place to walk that night. Calvin then when we got late at night very kindly gave us ice. In the morning Karely was exepcional helped us by calling our airline to see if our flight was underway and was half an hour on the phone checking and did not care excellent service from front desk team. spectacular restaurant food thanks we spent a lovely stay thanks to this great team..I coming back this year and i hope to see you all.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at UVA!”
Reviews.Author: FLMomandAttorney
Reviews.Content: Beautiful beachside boutique hotel with great views and modern decoration. My favorite part about this hotel is definitely the restaurant, UVA. I recently visited UVA to attend a friend's birthday party. We had a huge party, about 15 people or more. The food was just phenomenal! I can't recall what everything was called, but we rolled out of there stuffed and happy. My husband had the rib eye dumpling as an appetizer and he said it was the best dumpling he has ever had. The plating was beautiful too. The service was quite good. We brought our toddlers as well and the staff was super nice about getting us extra napkins and utensils. They even made some chicken tenders that my children devoured! For a small seaside restaurant, the food and experience surpassed my expectations. I would definitely come back for more!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: msmarsha310
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I are from the states, and plan on getting married in San Juan. We found Hosteria Del Mar and a couple of other venues to choose from for our wedding. We decided to travel to San Juan and see it for ourselves. We stayed at Hosteria (The end of September) for our stay. The hotel is beautiful! Our room was one of their Ocean front rooms, and you have access and a beautiful view of the beach. We would wake up, and walk out to the beach front restaurant and have breakfast; it was so convenient and delicious. The bartender (Gabriel) makes great drinks; the staff is great and very attentive. I have no complaints about this hotel in fact we will be getting married here in March! I canâ€™t wait :-)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: P R
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I stayed here for 3 nights to celebrate our 10-year anniversary. Lovely place with a great staff. Very eclectic and casual, quiet during the day, which is what I wanted. I was trying to avoid the hustle and bustle, and we found that here. It is right on the beach - I walked out my back door and took 10 steps to hit sand, another 20 steps to water. Great beach, not very busy. The room was basic - good bed, nice TV, bathroom. Some reviews mentioned no hot water, and we noticed it was never "hot", but it was generally at least warm. It didn't really matter since the temps were in the 80s. Definitely not a fancy room, but charming and practical and met our needs. The restaurant serves the best coffee! We had breakfast one day and dinner another, and the food was excellent. The bar made great drinks and offered great service. Speaking of service, Edguardo, the front desk clerk who apparently never gets a day off, was top notch. He arranged tours for us, called cabs, took care of beach towels...anything we needed. He is worth his weight in gold. At night the place livened up quite a bit with the dinner crowd and loud Caribbean music, but I didn't find it bothersome at all. In fact, our room was right beside the restaurant, and even with the music and diners, never had a single problem getting to sleep at night. And I'm a country girl, who can't sleep with "city noise" in the background. This was "Caribbean Beach Party" in the backdrop, and it was just fine. The trade-off here: cost of cabs. It was $10-$20 each way to get to downtown San Juan or Old San Juan, depending on the whims of the cab driver. We could have ridden the bus for $.75, but were more comfortable using cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: Miriam C
Reviews.Content: Gladys was very friendly and helful. Great customer service! The only thing that wasn't perfect was the shower temperature never got completely warm. Everything else was great!

Reviews.Title: “Slow and inattentive service, rooms in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: crewfox
Reviews.Content: Hosteria del Mar enjoys a privileged location on Ocean Park beach, but it unfortunately does not live up to expectations. The rooms leave much to be desired. In addition to my numerous visits to their restaurant, where the service is PAINFULLY slow and indifferent and the food is average at best, a large party of our friends and family members stayed here for our recent wedding, and their opinions were all consistent - nice location, but terrible rooms and worse service. Closet doors are creaky and sometimes fall off their sliding rails, bathrooms need updating, and the furniture and bedspreads look timeworn and not very clean. The guest house has recently been more and more frequently hosting wild, loud parties until all hours of the night, which means that having a quiet, restful stay is out of the question. It is noteworthy that while the hotel has been promoting itself as a destination wedding venue, and is hosting weddings on the beach, the PR department of natural resources requires a permit for any wedding taking place on the beach, and they are not easy to obtain. Buyer beware if you are thinking of planning a wedding here - if you don't have a permit, you run the risk of your wedding ceremony being shut down. Overall, I recommend you go elsewhere. This place doesn't live up to expectations for a calm, relaxed Caribbean getaway.

Reviews.Title: “"Romantic Carribean Getaway"”
Reviews.Author: Joni H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderfully romantic dinner at the hotel's restaurant. I cannot say enough about the shic, carribean atmosphere... it was fabulous, straight out of an old, Humphrey Boghart movie (the dark carribean wood, the rattan, the white and tourquise accessories). The food and drinks were fabulous, and the staff made it an even more enjoyable experience. We topped it off by a walk on the beach in front of the restaurant with drinks in hand. Lovely!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: JasonRosserCali
Reviews.Content: My g/f and I stayed here for four nights, and loved it. Shower in our room was tricky for hot water, but we got it the 2nd day. Most of the touristy stuff is far away, an hour to snorkel for example. But the beach is phenomenal (wear insect repellant) the staff ( Edgardo and Gladys) were extremely helpful, even when we just ran into her on the streets. The food was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Clydej”
Reviews.Author: Clyde334
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the hotel with ocean views. It was wonderful. The sounds of the surf and the breezes put you to sleep right away. The beach is very close and most of the time we spent in the waves. The staff, especially Edgardo and Dimos, were terrific. Everybody was very friendly and nice. We would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Gardo7
Reviews.Content: we went to Hosteria for a weekend and we love it. The staff is nice and willing to help all the time. Room was clean and nice. Our ocean view was the best and the sound of the waves at night make our stay pleasant. Restaurant food was great and the service excelent. Bar Lounge at the back is the best place for relaxation at night time.

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: karem g
Reviews.Content: For me this was one of my worst experiences Iâ€™ve had staying in a hotel. I stayed a weekend with my boyfriend hoping for a romantic gateway we both left feeling utterly disappointed. The room was unkempt, it had a musky smell. One was squeaky and other one had some weird stains in the bed post, the sheets and towels were dirty. Our room key did not worked properly we had to jiggle it for about five minutes every time we went back to our room. The management answer to this was the doors are tricky. Why not invest some money into some new door handles and better cleaning services. Food was good but the waiting time was unreasonable. We had to wait over 45 minutes for our breakfast to be served even thought the restaurant was pretty much empty. The only think positive that I can say about our stay is that the view from our room was beautiful besides that I would not stay there again nor would I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its best”
Reviews.Author: Poorgourmet
Reviews.Content: The hostel is highly recommended; just in front of a beautiful beach and exquisite food. The UVVA restaurant is located at the entrance to the hostel and the food is superb... I cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: jcmpr15
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I had an amazing time staying at your hotel this past weekend. We cannot wait to return and are telling all our friends about it.

Reviews.Title: “calm oasis in hectic San Juan”
Reviews.Author: SoozAppleBay_Tortola
Reviews.Content: I enjoy solo traveling, but when I arrived in San Juan, I felt nervous. Crowds and freeways aren't the best ingredients for a peaceful tropical vacation. I'd brought a list of hotels and on a whim called Hosteria del Mar. They had a room. I was amazed (and relieved) to find such a laid-back, friendly little hotel in the middle of such a big city. Just below my comfortable ocean view room, miles of clean beach waited for my footprints, and the cozy hotel restaurant, which offers food any time of day, served me up some of the best food I've ever tasted. This hotel has just right mix of "casual" and "elegant". For me at least. Will I go back. You bet!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in San Juan”
Reviews.Author: brian e
Reviews.Content: Angel at the front desk was superb in his service. He constantly gave us tips on cool things to do and see, helped us with directions, made phone calls to places to check their hours of operations. He treated us like family and was sincere. We would go back just because he works there! The hotel was lovely itself. From the moment we walked into the lobby we were smiling. The room was not anything too fancy-just a room, but it was large. Anyway, we did not go to stay in the room, we just needed it to sleep @ night. The lobby and the beach is where it is at. The breakfast was EXCELLENT in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Karen1129
Reviews.Content: We went to Puerto Rico looking for something different and we find it. This Hotel is so beautiful. The staff is incredible and they make you feel at home. This guy that work in front desk his name is Edgardo, he is very friendly and always willing to help . That guy is a very important asset to this hotel. He made our stay very comfortable and his service was 5 stars, always with a smile on his face.

Reviews.Title: “We had a Great Time! Would Definitely Go Back!”
Reviews.Author: Adam1254002
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Hosteria Del Mar was incredible. My fiance and I went there for a nice romantic getaway and we couldn't have asked for more. The staff was very friendly and accomodating, especially Angel in particular. From the very beginning he was very welcoming and went out of his way to help us. He gave us some great recommendations on good places to eat. If you are looking for some good breakfast or a huge selection of baked goods, make sure to check out Kasalta, which is only a couple blocks walk from the hotel. On our last night in San Juan, my fiance and I wanted to eat some seafood, so Angel looked up a great seafood restaurant just a short ride from the hotel and called us a cab. The beach is really nice of course and the food here at the restaurant is also good, although a little pricey. If you are looking for some fun things to do while you are here, consider checking out El Yunque rainforest. Angel set us up with a tour guide who was very knowledgeable and led us on a 1.5mile hike through the beautiful rainforest. Great opportunity to take some nice pictures. Definitely checkout Old San Juan and the San Felipe El Morre Fort. About the only complaint we had with the hotel was the lack of hot water. We were there for 4 nights, and not once did we have any hot water to take a shower with. I had mentioned this to another staff member, but it seemed like this was the norm as the hotel's heated water comes from solar power. The staff memeber informed us that because of this, hot water sometimes quickly runs out. We tried showering at different times throughout the day, and even let the water run, but it still never turned hot, although warmed up slightly. To be honest though, it's so hot here, you probably aren't going to care if you are able to take a hot shower! Overall, we had a great experience, and would definitely come back. If you decide to stay here, I hope you have the pleasure of dealing with Angel, and if not, don't be afraid to ask for him. You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “17 days Puerto Rico”
Reviews.Author: ValentinoRomelio
Reviews.Content: Thanks for the stay. Hosteria Del Mar is a nice warm place and I would definitely consider coming back. For people who are not used to a cold shower, get used to it :) Regards, Valentino

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer188616
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice ambiance, excellent restaurant and bar and ofcourse friendly and helpfull staff. Angel Morales one of the staff members took really good care of us during our stay. We will defenitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer care”
Reviews.Author: edselmachado
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel on an excellent location. Nicely decorated rooms, adequate beach. Edgardo, from front desk, takes great care and is very dedicated to his work. He made my stay that much more comfortable. Would stay here again!!!

Reviews.Title: “The place are very nice, cute and comfortable. We think that will be back soon.”
Reviews.Author: Betty_Boop65_11
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice view. The rooms are comfortables and cleans. Have a very good services in all areas and the employees are loving. We likes to recommended some persons: 1. Edgardo - front desk = He is very attentive, friendly and very helpful. Was always willing to help. He is a very good person and love his job. 2. Felix - work at the restaurant - He is very attentive, friendly and very helpful. Was always willing to help. He is a very good person and love his job. Every service in the restaurant, from all employees was excelent and the food was good..... 3. Angel Morales - He is very attentive, friendly and very helpful. Was always willing to help. In general, all services are excellents. We wants to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place wonderful people and will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: curbysplace
Reviews.Content: We knew we were going to have a great experience at the Hosteria del Mar from the moment we arrived. Edgardo at the reception desk made sure we were well taken care of with his exceptional service and very pleasant demeanor. When we checked in he asked us out of the blue if we â€œwould mindâ€� if he upgraded us to room that opened right onto the beach. The room originally we booked online was a room that was supposed to be in the back of the hotel facing into the Ocean Park neighborhood. Edgardo went above and beyond with this unrequested upgrade. This set the tone for what kind of place the Hosteria is. The room was perfect for the two of us. It was clean with plenty of closet space. We arrived about 2:30 in the afternoon the day before our Royal Caribbean cruise departed. And not knowing if our flight to San Juan would be delayed and the fact that we were going to board our ship around noon the next day we did not want to spend as much as the hotels in the Condado or Old Town were asking. And with Hosteria del Mar being right on the beach it appeared from the reviews, pictures and location to meet our needs for an overnight stay. From what you can tell we made an excellent choice. The reviews I read did an injustice to the location of the hotel because these reviews said there is nothing by the way of restaurants or activities (other than the beach) in the vicinity. A mere ten-minute walk takes you to many local restaurants and clubs. A fifteen to twenty-minute walk gets you to the Condado. We enjoyed the beach the afternoon we arrived. We ordered lunch from the restaurant at the Hosteria and sat at a table on the beach. The beach was clean and continuously groomed. What more could you ask for. The next morning before we left for the pier to board the ship we spent a good three hours on the beach swimming, lounging and taking a nice leisurely stroll to the end of the beach. I would definitely stay here on a future visit to San Juan and would love to do so for more than one night. The hospitality went above and beyond what they needed to do for us.

Reviews.Title: “Little Hotel with beautiful beach!”
Reviews.Author: Jazminvirag
Reviews.Content: We stayed only two days in this lovely hotel before our cruise ship depart from San Juan. The staff were very helpful, they phoned a lot after our lost baggage. The hotel is nice and clean and the restaurant is very good as well! The beach is beautiful! Wi-Fi worked well! We loved our short stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location with boutique hotel charm”
Reviews.Author: lae883
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at hosteria del mar. I was there for a wedding and the ceremony on the beach and the small reception was amazing. I am used to more standard hotels with hair dryer and irons in every room and that definately wasn't how the hotel was. It was nice however to get to know all the hotel staff and if there was anything we needed that wasn't in the room the staff was there to help. The new owners are amazing and I hope all the rooms continue to be renovated and we will definately come back again and again. (our first room was in a not renovated room and we asked to switch, bathroom just wasn't great. Good food at hotel restaurant Uvva, a little pricey but worth it. Would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great place but the management is awful !”
Reviews.Author: Cvxlawrence
Reviews.Content: I went over this great beach found this little hotel , the girl who attend me a tall girl was great dnt remember her name . Well I was staying down the block & I switch hotel , restaurant was good but needs alots things to get fixed please so something for it , food & servers were great ! Restaurant manager awful how can a place like this has such a bad temper and not a professional person running this place . After my dinner when out to wait for a taxi & the manager restaurant was outside doing some weird things , rooms are so old not cute , it really needs a good fixed , a better manager & organization , but if the manager keeps smoking & doing weird stuff outside nothing will happen . Over all only the servers & the restaurant are the only good things there .

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!! I can't wait to go back next year.”
Reviews.Author: Asanchez61306
Reviews.Content: I met Angel, who works the front desk. He was so hospitable, friendly and professional. He gave us (in my opinion) the BEST oceanfront room. I felt like a queen. Their hotel staff was so kind and friendly as well. An associate even stopped what she was doing just to welcome me to the hotel. It was a fabulous experience. I wish we stayed longer than the one night. Next morning, we had breakfast on the beach. Food was wonderful, service was great and the view was unforgettable. FIVE STARS all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “charming and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: ildg
Reviews.Content: I am helping organize my sister's destination wedding event in at Hosteria del Mar and so far, it has been a pleasant experience. The hotel was chosen because of it's rustic and charming look as well as it's proximity to the beach and previous positive gastric experiences. When we met the hotels' event coordinator, she was very friendly approachable, and professional. She showed us around and gave us a very thorough tour of all the areas we could use for the reception (which were very beautiful) and explained in details all the possibilities for decorative purposes. She suggested many helpful ideas and until now, has always been easily available for any inquiry or just about anything we might need. The wedding is due in August 2011, and the bride had changed her mind a lot of times previous to signing the contract. About this, Iris (event coordinator) has been very gracious, understanding and patient at all times. We are very much looking forward to my sister's wedding day because, judging by the way we have been treated, I'm confident the hotel's special events staff will take good care of us on such an important day.

Reviews.Title: “Not the most welcoming of places”
Reviews.Author: Notin_11
Reviews.Content: I live in the states and was hoping to get estimates for a casual wedding ceremony. Went to the island expressly to pick a place. Made an appointment with Iris who was very nice and receptive over the phone. Once there she showed the place in a rush and while looking at the place on the second floor she asked me about the other places I was considering which seemed it gave her the impression that I wanted a low budget wedding. She farewelled me in the middle of showing the place from the second floor saying she had things to do in her office and that she would email me an estimate. I said ok but I was expecting her to talk to me about what the place had to offer besides the room upstairs. Once I received the estimate it was a very generic estimate without any options of any kind. I asked for a more customized estimate which I never received. The place is nice but it is in a neighborhood and it is cramped. It has a nice view to the beach and the beach is great but the treatment left me with a sour note. I have never experienced this is the states, simply lack of interest in doing business and a good business person knows you can't ignore people because you never know what they may bring. I give them an D- for customer service in terms of organizing an event there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing. Fantastic staff, rooms.”
Reviews.Author: comexbackkid
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I were here just for one night. Our standby tickets bumped us an extra night in San Juan, so we needed a place to stay fast. The employee on duty, Angel, was extremely friendly and helpful and was able to accomodate us and went above and beyond to make us comfortable and happy. You don't ever get service like this, anywhere. We stayed in the cheaper room, around $120 or so, there were others that faced the ocean which would have been awesome but we wanted to limit our expenses since we were already over budget. Room was clean, quiet, everything worked. No disturbances. There's a Dell netbook computer in the lobby so if you need internet access it's free of charge. I would recommend this place to anyone. Great service, staff, and hotel accommodations. A+

Reviews.Title: “Good on-the-beach value.”
Reviews.Author: RobRoselle
Reviews.Content: We went to Puerto Rico for my girlfriends birthday and wanted to stay right on the beach as opposed to a block or more away. This was perfect for that and our budget. There are certainly nicer hotels but the people were very courteous and responsive, the food at the restaurant was good, the location was excellent and from our room we could walk onto the beach. We would likely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experience”
Reviews.Author: scooter1019
Reviews.Content: Hosteria Del Mar is a must to stay at while in Puerto Rico. Everything Angel D. Morales Pinero told us about and promissed was done. He made sure our entire stay was great. He is a huge asset to the hotel. Edgardo was very helpful when we checked in. He too is an asset to the hotel. Xavier Toro, the Manager, also went up and above to make sure all our needs were met.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect wedding I could ever imagine”
Reviews.Author: Mrs_Carr_11
Reviews.Content: How do I start. I found Hosteria Del Mar through the recommendation of my photographer in PR. I contacted Loisse, who was absolutely fabulous from the beginning. When I inquired about wedding details, she replied with a personalized e-mail, which was the first I had received, and gave her phone number. I called and spoke with Fernando, who didn't tell me then, but I later found out he was the owner, and he talked with me for about 45 mins. He made me feel so comfortable and at ease that I knew I had to hire them immediately. I never met anyone in PR before I arrive the weekend of my wedding, but with the e-mails that Loisse and I sent back and forth, I felt very welcomed and comfortable. When we arrived at the resort, we walked in and there was such a relaxed, and elegant feel to the place as soon as you walked through the doors. Egardo, the front desk manager, treated us like family. He wanted to make sure that everything was to our liking, and that we were pleased with our rooms and our stay. He was beyond polite, he was sweet and caring. We had a fabulous room with an ocean view balcony, the bed was comfortable and our flat screen tv made us feel like we had the luxuries of home while still having the breath takingly beautiful views. Our wedding was the most incredible thing I could ever imagine. We were married on the resort's beach, which gave the most amazing pictures you could dream of. Our reception was so incredibly perfect, it was unreal. The wait staff was amazing, friendly, and always served to please. I can honestly say I couldn't have dreamed of a more perfect wedding than what we had at Hosteria Del Mar!

Reviews.Title: “Made our first trip to PR a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Pearl1013
Reviews.Content: I booked our accommodations thru Expedia and I had questions and requestsso I called and emailed the Hosteria and people there especially Angel were very helpful. When we got there at 2:00 am our room was ready and we did not encounter any major problems throughout our one week stay. The staff was always friendly and willing to help special mention to Angel, Eduardo, Christopher, Calvin and the girls at the bar. The hosteria is in a very secure location and beach was beautiful. Just one suggestion- you need more fitted bedsheets and pillows. We will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Hosteria del Mar is a tranquil, classy, beautifully rustic inn on the sea.”
Reviews.Author: vzajac
Reviews.Content: comfortably casual atmosphere the people you meet there are very friendly quiet and relaxing delightful shower head nice pillows mattress a little hard bathroom had broken faucets in shower missing light bulb in bathroom closet door off track no wash/face cloths in the bathroom would like a telephone in the room in order to contact front desk or for emergency would like a clock in the room would like to be able to move beach chairs closer to ocean

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Great Location on the beach, but a bit noisy.”
Reviews.Author: WSFAMILY7
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on Saturday May 22, 2011. Christian was amazing, I was lost and he allowed me to follow him in to the hotel. Edgardo checked us in and was so kind and helpful. The room was on the small side even for just me and my 15 yr old daughter. The bed was nice, the room was clean. The bathroom has no counter space. I also did not get any hot water. We stayed in room 104 and was near the bar/resturant it was right out the door to the beach and the music was loud and played for a long time, people were sitting at tables right out the patio door, when I complained I was told that they did not own the resturant and had no control of the volume. I guess I was fussy becuase I had to be at the airport at 5am. I think that if I had more time and didnt have to get up so early and could relax and enjoy I would definately stay again but if I had another early flight I would a little less noisy room.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay.”
Reviews.Author: aatqz64
Reviews.Content: to me the best thing was the location, Staff. If you are going to stay in Hosteria Del Mar, Ask for Angle on Front Desk or Edgar. In resturant ask for Felix or Edwardo. Top class service. Resturant is kind of expensive but close to the hotel there are few places for Breakfast , lunch and dinner. Make sure let Angle know about your plan, he would help you on planning your trip and to save some money. Thank you Angle and all staff of Hosteria Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be back”
Reviews.Author: demaples
Reviews.Content: Pros: if you want a quiet stay on the beach ok rooms ok, beds ok, staff ok, food ok. Two best waitresses are jennifer and Illiana. Cons: restaurant prices a bit stiff, bar prices high, was there on mothers day got tossed from the restaurant then my waitress made me a drink in the bar but was tossed from there because of unknown private party. Waiters do not check back to see if food is ok and if you need another drink, you have to flag them down.Room 205 patio door warped and would only lock with chain. Windows won't open. Neighborhood scary even though in a gated neighborhood anybody can walk in. Burglar bars on second and third row floors and fences and walls around local homes tells alot. No pool. Wifi only in lobby. No room service. Beach ok lots of cig butts. Glass allowed on beach. No elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: apemoulie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hosteria Del Mar for the first two nights of our honeymoon in Puerto Rico. Our stay was everything we imagined. Just like the pictures show, the hotel is right on the beach and is incredibly beautiful. Angel (front desk) was exceptionally helpful, from general hotel needs to restaurant recommendations. For the entire stay, we felt welcomed and it made a difference. Had a great night at the bar, fantastic drinks in good company and the coffee in the morning was possibly the best singular cup we've had since Seattle. We would absolutely suggest staying at Hosteria del Mar, and we will DEFINITELY return. Thanks Angel!!!! -Alex & Kevin

Reviews.Title: “3.7 stars”
Reviews.Author: Yinapm
Reviews.Content: This is a great little beach front hotel. Positives: The staff is friendly and helpful. The hotel is charming. It is close to great bars and attractions. It is in a gated community. Oh, we had a small flat screen in our room w an ipod dock which was cool. Negs: All that being said, we stayed in one of the ground level rooms which was small and did not have a window which is disadvantageous for those of us who can't get up without some sun. The bathroom needed remodeling, it was dated and didn't have a shelf to put any toiletries on. Also, there isn't a pool on site. We had a great stay, just dont expect luxury if you are staying in one of the standard rooms (#5). Angel was helpful from the start, he should get a raise. ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Swanky lobby simple room”
Reviews.Author: Anna60745
Reviews.Content: The service at this place was outstanding. My tip for future visitors, if there is anything you need just ask for Angel. He was helpful prior to our arrival and the service continued throughout our stay. The lobby and cafe are lovely and worth the visit. More than one option for vegetarians to eat and even had something on the menu for a delish vegan dinner. The room we stayed in was simple (as we were in a room with no view, etc. Just needed a place to stay for the night) and clean. Even had a nice hot water shower.

Reviews.Title: “Good service”
Reviews.Author: CJD_34
Reviews.Content: Arrived without a reservation and Angel at the Front desk took very good care of us and made sure that everything we needed was taken care of promptly.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Standard Room!!”
Reviews.Author: geodrum
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled with another couple to this hotel. We stayed in a standard room while our friends stayed on the second floor with an ocean view. If we had stayed in their room, I'd probably give this hotel an additional star, but staying on the first floor was atrocious. The hotel is directly on the ocean, and the view is undeniably beautiful. Enjoying the "beach" however is another story. The sand is course and FULL of seaweed that the hotel does nothing to clean up. Swimming was always cut short when we'd finally get sick of unwrapping seaweed from our ankles (one local told us he didn't consider this area a beach as much as he did an oceanfront property; he also noted that there are some dangerous currents not far from shore in this area). The hotel only as 10 beach chairs for all of its guests, so space is a premium. No umbrellas available. They also ran out of beach towels on a daily basis, so we typically had to wait 20-30 minutes for towels to become available. Our room was comparable to a dungeon. It had one window that, if opened, faced a storage closet and set of stairs (which meant we heard all of the drunks going to the second floor quite easily at 3 in the morning). No daylight, no ventilation, no fridge. The room has a single desk lamp lighting the entire room, no overhead light (this, combined with no daylight, made for a very dark and depressing experience). The bathroom was dirty and BADLY in need of an overhaul. The sink was unattached from the wall, the mirror is stupidly placed five feet off the ground so my wife had to stand on the toilet to put her makeup on. The shower pressure is non-existent, takes 5-10 minutes to get warm water, and floods the bathroom floor when you're done. The restaurant and bar were also disappointing. The food ranges from mediocre to inedible and comes with Manhattan prices attached. Service ranged from friendly to indifferent and was universally slow (but that's common to San Juan in general). Beautiful views while eating help compensate. The bar was predictably overpriced, charging $10 for a single rail mix drink. We couldn't find any bars within walking distance, so reasonable drinks would have gone a long ways in easing our tension. I'm not sure what the business model is, but it doesn't seem to be geared toward attracting as many customers as possible. If the Standard Room is all that is available, DO NOT stay at this hotel. Ocean view rooms are acceptable, but nothing to write home about. We really regretted not renting a car given the beautiful but relatively isolated location (it cost $16-20 one way for a taxi to get anywhere).

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing”
Reviews.Author: rhw2011
Reviews.Content: The location was beautiful. The restaurant and staff were great - although prices were even more expensive than NYC. The room was waaayy overpriced - apparently the best room in the place - the bottom sheet didn't fit the mattress - we had to put on a replacement ourselves after asking several times - but it had been removed the next night. The room was stuffy and there was plastic on several windows, not screens- we couldn't open then without letting in bugs. The shower barely worked the first night. But worst was the attitude of the management who clearly did not care, had no clue how to take care of disgruntled customers, and had no interest in taking care of us in any way whatsoever. I would have loved to recommend this place to friends, but not after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, affordable, and paradise!”
Reviews.Author: mattynels
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived to the moment I left I was completely relaxed. The Hosteria is a perfect place. Nestled in a quiet neighborhood (Ocean Park) and right on the beach, I would go back in a second. Amazing pina coladas and good food as well!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Food & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AlaMoe
Reviews.Content: The food is amazing! the ambiance, beach and decor is what did it for me! The dinner staff is much more friendly then the lunch staff. The rooms were nicely decorated good size, small bathrooms and need better cleaning service but overall a nice place to stay. Most staff are friendly. I left my bathing suit and sarong in the closet, when I called to ask about it, the front desk person refused to help me and "the rooms are cleaned daily and nothing has been brought to the front desk" I stayed in the room 5ft away from the front desk!! geeez! Anyway after speaking to the Manager, of course it was found and she was so Kind to mail to my Chicago address Free of charge!!! Check-in time is rather late 4pm but you can always lounge on the beach and have something to eat. The location is great away from the busy clutter of hotels on the beach, it is in a quiet residential area. The food and location are soooo worth it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “They need to invest in new mattresses... Seriously!”
Reviews.Author: Jjharper
Reviews.Content: The location is amazing- right on the beach! The restaurant is great thought pricey- 100$ for two- the rooms are nice enough if you aren't too picky- one negative, and it is a big negative, the mattress was horrible- like a pull out couch- seriously- cheap and flimsy and you could feel the springs and it was lopsided- if they don't fix that I would say stay elsewhere-

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting little hotel”
Reviews.Author: juliana15
Reviews.Content: I left enchanted from this beautiful boutique hotel. The views from every corner were amazing, the service was great, to wake up in front of the beach is priceless, and they have the best cocktails. My husband and i really enjoyed the stay here and can't wait to go back. Thank you guys for a wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great food, not great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Estacita
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hosteria Del Mar for two nights before traveling to the west coast of PR. The best part of the hotel was having the beach right there and the great restaurant on site. We enjoyed swimming, watching the kite boarders, laying in the sun, and walking the beach. The location was fantastic in terms of the beach and the restaurant on site fantastic, but the hotel itself was not what it has potential to be. I can't speak for the other rooms in the hotel, but I felt we were paying hotel price to stay in a room that was not as high of quality as some hostels I stayed in while backpacking in Europe. There were not enough lights in the room. One light had an awful florescent glow. The window in the bathroom was broken but the fact was hidden by a bamboo curtain. Another bamboo curtain in the bedroom was broken so you could not pull it up. The light fixture in the bathroom was rusting and two double beds had been pushed together to form a king. The closet door was broken. One of the pillows on the bed was protected with a crinkly plastic cover. This would have all been fine if we were paying no more than $50-75 a night but we paid over $100. It is just a shame that fixes that could occur in a day had not happened. I read a similar review about the hotel but heard it was under new ownership so thought I would give it a try. Basically I would not feel comfortable recommending a family member or friend to stay here, but it is possible the other rooms are nicer. I should note that while maintenance was needed badly, the hotel was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Room location matters”
Reviews.Author: ggooding
Reviews.Content: This is an outstanding little hotel right on the beach. The only downside is if you get stuck in a room next to the bar. They play loud music until 10:30 pm and it can feel like you are sleeping on the dance floor. On the second night, we asked them to turn the music down and when they turned it down, it was still a nuisance. The funny thing is the bar is consistently empty. We never ate here and had one set of overpriced drinks. Can't beat the location, though They also have nice beach chairs to use if you want to relax. The area around the hotel is very safe and within walking distance of good food options. The room itself was very simple, which is good if you expect to be out of it for the most of the day and night.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good experience with a few complaints”
Reviews.Author: globetrottingscoops
Reviews.Content: First impressions are important. The hotel is situated right on the beach so you can see the beautiful ocean as you are walking past a Koi pond and a waterfall. The lobby is nicely decorated and opens up into the restaurant. But I was a put off by our reception. When I arrive at a place of business, I expect to be greeted professionally. Unfortunately, the woman at the desk seemed unfriendly and busy. She briskly told us that check is at 4pm (It was noon) and turned back to the computer. I admit, I should have checked that detail but 4pm??? I've NEVER seen such a late check-in? So we are standing there shocked by her brusqueness and I asked if there was a place to put our luggage while we waited and explored. She walked us into an open, dirty room in the back courtyard that housed the air conditioning units and pointed. There were many other suitcases there. Not very confidence inspiring, but we didn't have a choice. Once we got into our room, we found it comfortable but the shower faucet was broken and the daily maid service wasn't as thorough as one would expect. I enjoyed my stay but for I think for the cost of the hotel, SOME of the reception clerks and bar staff needs to be reminded that they are in the hospitality industry and could be a little friendlier and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Overrated”
Reviews.Author: indie18
Reviews.Content: I chose this place because of good reviews on Trip Advisor and a few people I know, and after my stay I was baffled by the recommendations. On the plus side, the lobby area was pretty and its right on the beach. However, the room was awful. We stayed in one of the apartments. I've stayed in basic cheap motels for a third of the price that were much better quality. The floors were so filthy I had to wear socks in the room at all times. There was a dark brown smudge on the floor in the bathroom. Didn't know what it was, but it was near the toilet. The couch smelled mildewy and all the furniture was pretty old. The shower had water that was either too hot or too cold water. The windows were broken and could not be closed all the way, so to make up for it they blasted the air conditioner. There was no bar to hang up the toilet paper. There was no clock. Bed was comfortable though. The service was not terrible but not great. I had to wait several minutes for anyone to show up at the front desk when I came to check in and he then seemed confused and spacy. For a hotel that charged me $200 a night, I expected a computer with a printer in the lobby so I could print out my boarding pass, and getting any help from the staff was a slow, complicated process.

Reviews.Title: “It was the dream wedding... for my husband!”
Reviews.Author: PaolaGalvis
Reviews.Content: I never wanted to get married in the beach, but my husband did. We found Hosteria del Mar and it fit perfectly with my husbands vision and our budget. Our wedding was intimate and Hosteria del Mar was the perfect setting. The staff was very helpful before, during and after our special day. This location is perfect for small renunions and romatic dates at the beach. Actually we're planning to celebrate our first month as husband and wife at Uva, Hoseria's restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “A Hidden Gem in San Juan PR”
