Reviews.Author: lynrub
Reviews.Content: Small and beautiful beachfront hotel with a excellent restaurant. This is hidden inside a gated community of the Ocean Park section of San Juan. Do not hesitate to stay here. The staff is warm and friendly, the rooms clean and comfortable, and the food is superb!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ECPuertoRico
Reviews.Content: The service was outstanding the staff went out of their way to be helpful. The accommodations were adequate not luxurious but the atmosphere more than made up for lack of luxury. Sitting at breakfast every morning looking out the open window at the beautiful blue ocean was a great way to start the day. The food was fabulous at the Hosteria, we were with a large group and most people stayed there to eat more than they went out.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a romantic beach front Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Carmen2011
Reviews.Content: I celebrated my wedding from evening to the night and the place was espectacular. All the guests enjoyed the place, the beachfront and the memories will be amazing for all of us. They arranged the salon and provided food and drinks to all guests in vary nice manner. The offer was great, it caused no burden to plan it and we either got to stay for the night in a very comfy bed!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !!”
Reviews.Author: Karine78
Reviews.Content: We arrived the night before our cruise was leaving. This was the most beautiful suprise ever. We were paying 90$ for a basic room. A bed, ( WITHOUT bedbugs, a shower) But all the ammenties of the hotel, the reception, the bars, the restaurant Are excellent. THE RESTAURANT!!! Wow that was wonderful. The food was to die for, The steak was perfect and in appetizer we had was Cilantro coconut Shrimps and Cheeses and chips ( A mix of goat and mozzarella cheese encrusted with plantain and Guava Tomato Sauce) Humm humm hummm !! Having a bottle of wine at the bar litteraly ON the beach. Everything about this place is perfect! Do not hesited to stay here. After the cruise we stayed somewhere else and it was definitely not as cool as here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great.....But has the potential to be INCREDIBLE!”
Reviews.Author: DateNiteDinners
Reviews.Content: The location , and the staff were awesome (Angel, Jose', and a evening server (female) who's name escapes me). Totally loved the dinning room and menu. The room was............ Clean (the smell of bleach is always welcomed), cold, and uninviting. But the balcony and view were priceless!!!! It's my inderstanding that the owner is doing a mass renovation of this property (hence the sawing & hammering ). What was missing was 1. HOT RUNNING WATER. 2. A soap dish. Beyond that, we had a fabulous time here. San Juan wasn't "ALL THAT" as a whole. But when I return (IF), I will defintely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “An appealing small beachfront hotel in a neighborhood setting.”
Reviews.Author: Alex14326
Reviews.Content: After an initial reservation problem was resolved in a manner satisfactory to all, a warm and friendly atmosphere prevailed for the three days of our visit. We were quite pleased with the location of the hotel, with our room, and with the special service provided by the staff. In particular, Denisse and her female colleague (whose name I am embarrassed to say I cannot remember) and Angel were terrific. They all went well beyond the norm for helpful service to ensure that we were content and well taken care of. We were! We would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Seaside Hotel with Fantastic Food!”
Reviews.Author: FLAttorney
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel when I came down to take the Federal Bar Exam. The staff was super friendly and the room was very neat and comfortable. I was impressed that it had a flat screen TV and a king size bed. The restaurant UVA was fantastic! The chef is very talented as the food was IRON CHEF quality. The mango and strawberry frappes and the plaintain encrusted fish dish were delicious!!!! Not to mention that you are dining directly on the beach and watching the waves crash against the sand. It was so romantic. To say the least, I could not study that night, but I didn't care because it helped me relax for the test the following morning. I would come definitely come again!

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: Roccoitaly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hosteria del mar for 9 days during the holidays season in november. I got this great room with the ocean view,with balcony. The staff was very nice and helpful,friendly,the make me feel like i was at home,i felt very confortable and safe since i was alone. The beach is right in front of the hotel,which makes it very convinent,but the best part was the restaurant inside the hotel,they have a great great Chef,food was incredible,i think in 9 days i ate there 14 times between lunch and dinner and i am very particular eater. I would like to thank especially the young couple who ran the hotel,they were very kind with me,always attentive,and willing to give advice things to do and place to go. I recommend to everybody,and my next visit to san juan i will stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Puerto Rico do it better!”
Reviews.Author: bperez29
Reviews.Content: It's a beautiful place in Ocean Park with an excelent food menu and taste, the rooms are cute.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely setting, disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: Buthraupis
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at HosterÃ­a del Mar on my way to the Lesser Antilles. I chose this hotel because of the TripAdvisor reviews. As an older traveler, I seek quiet places in soothing settings, away from glitz and night life. The del Mar would have been perfect, as it is located on a great beach in a lovely residential neighborhood. I chose one of their best rooms, with a balcony overlooking the sea. It was a small room but nicely furnished with a comfortable bed. Negatives were inadequate lighting for reading and dirty windows. Unfortunately, the restaurant is directly below. Although there were few customers the night I was there, one group of chatty women came in late and stayed overtime. The restaurant is supposed to close at 10:30. More annoying was the continuous background music that went on till 11:00. It was mostly gentle music, but the sound ruined the experience of just hearing the natural sound of pounding surf. I could not get to sleep till they finally closed up. Early next morning I was awakened by the sound of a saw; my room was also near the maintenance shed. When I checked out I complained about the noise problems, and the manager Lois said that at this time of year they are getting ready for the season, and doing repairs. She offered me a free night's stay at a future date. I told her I would not stay there again, and would appreciate a discount on the room (which was exorbitantly expensive to start with). She very kindly agreed and gave me ten percent off. Still I paid over $200 for the room. In short, if you are not bothered by normal sounds of humanity, this hotel is a great place to relax. The view from the balcony is tropically lovely. The staff are also friendly and helpful. In the restaurant I had one of the best meals I have ever eaten out. The Grand Marnier Creme Brulee was out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Not the experience I was looking for...”
Reviews.Author: Islands2010
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I were on vacation and spent several nights in a variety of hotels and cottages in the Caribbean. Hosteria Del Mar has a very welcoming staff and lobby. However, the rest of the stay is tired with several maintenance problems. It was average price for a very poor sleep. The TV was a computer monitor, the furniture was worn with water damage and the evening noise was difficult to sleep. Guests were not made to feel welcome at the beach bar or the restaurant. We never ate there because of that. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty , bed bugs , mosquitos , no water , smelly .. AVOID”
Reviews.Author: siempreengira
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night which turned out to be a few hours as i could not stay on the room due to poor hygene , noise and lack of water. An 80s TV , extremely noisy AC , no soundproofing at all , mosquitos , BED BUGS , mildew smell , foreign hairs in my bed , dirty covers, no interenet ... the list goes on and on..dirties hotel i ever stayed in.to top it , NO WATER! avoid specially if you want to avoid bringing bed bugs to your home which are impossible to get rid of by the way.

Reviews.Title: “If, if, if...”
Reviews.Author: FRiveraAustin_Texas
Reviews.Content: If the bathroom had been cleaned, if one could leave the courtyard without having to call the front desk (which is a serious hazard in an emergency), if when I asked the front desk guy if the restroom could be taken care of he hadn't taken me IN FRONT OF ALL THE MAIDS and announced that i had complained, if the employees would have helped my 82 year old aunt carry her suitcase... The location is very good, but I couldn't wait to leave. Oh, and the phone to the front desk wasn't even connected.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Romantic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Cate0817
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend for two nights in this small hotel and we were so happy to have picked this place. It is not pnly beautiful and romantic, but the restuarant UVVA in the hotel is FABULOUS!!! It does not have the fanciest rooms, but they are perfect for a couple nights stay... Right ON the water and our room had direct beach access!

Reviews.Title: “good alternative lodging when bored with hotels and not playing tourist”
Reviews.Author: eilcolvie
Reviews.Content: I booked the cheapest room in the place for myself. Room was on first floor, facing the beach and the restaurant terrace as well, a problem if other guests stay there until late. The room was very small and had no access to natural light without opening windows that faced the aforementioned terrace, the lamps were not bright enough for even reading in bed. The bed was ok, comfortable enough, room was clean and air conditioning & hot water worked just fine. Staff is extremely friendly and helpful, but I needed no assistance for I grew up in San Juan and know my way around. The beach is one of the nicest in metro San Juan, in a residential neighborhood. Included breakfast is most basic, allright to get one going but nothing substantial, small quantities. The restaurant is a bit overpriced and some dishes I tasted were amazing, others not. Service is slow. Area has much better restaurants in quality and price, but for an ocean front lunch the one in the hotel is quite nice as a treat on a lazy beach day. I did not mind the variables, then again I stayed in the cheapest room, which made it a great deal for the money. If I had to pay as much as larger hotels, I may not have felt the same, but for about a $100.00 U.S. a day? A good deal and far preferable than crashing at relative's guest room. Great place for shorter stays when renting one's own place is not possible and the larger hotels seem unpalatable.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Leaves a Lot to Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: SeriousBiz
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hosteria Del Mar for 4 nights and it was less than impressive. The accomodations are not well maintained and the staff were not helpful. At check-in, nobody mentioned the hours that the complimentary breakfast was served. Therefore, I was on my own the first morning and ended up at Kasalta (excellent). Hosteria charged for beach towels and for using the room safe without informing of the charges in advance. I felt like we were being nickled and dimed to death for a rustic, substandard room. The shower was in need of repair and had two water temperatures: scalding and cold. The beach chairs were falling apart and the premises were not well kept. They claim the place has been remodeled, but I could not tell that anything had been done in the last ten years. This place is one step up from camping. Initially I was excited about staying here because it is listed as a B&B and I though it would be more pleasant with personalized service. I felt like I was ignored after checking inn and they had their money. These rooms are WAY overpriced and I wish that I had stayed elsewhere. I wished that I had booked at Uno in Ocean Park or Hotel Milano in Old San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but it had it's faults”
Reviews.Author: jolener19
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the Hosteria Del Mar we were amazed at how beautiful it was, and right on the ocean. Attached to the hotel was a restaurant that looked to be promising. When we got there they had had a problem with the air conditioning in our room. When I say a problem I mean, I'm pretty sure the thing blew up because it was smoking and smelled something fowl. Nevertheless, they upgraded our room to the next floor up and we were very happy with this because after seeing the size of the room we were going to have, this one was a world of an upgrade. I defenitely would suggest staying in the 2nd floor. Our first night was amazing, although the dinner that we had at the restaurant there was not spectacular. It was good, but very over priced and the service is defenitely what you call, laid back- and we really aren't high maintenance diners. So everything was all well and good but we noticed our water wasn't very warm in the room. We told them about it the next day before we left for Old San Juan, they assured us that it would be fixed by the time we got back. Oh, and the continental breakfast is defenitely nothing extravegant. Once we got back to the hotel, they told us that it was fixed and by this time, I needed a shower.. but to no avail. I let the water run for a little over a half an hour, trying one nob and then the other. When I went downstairs the woman at the front desk told us that a repair man had come and looked at it and said it worked but you just had to wait for awhile. Once I assured them that I had let it run for well over a half an hour at this point, someone came with me to our room, only to find out that because they had switched their water tanks to solar days earlier.... the whole second floors hot water didn't work. After all this they offered us the room downstairs to use to shower so the rest of the trip we were commuting in our towels back and forth down stairs which was a little off puting. Where I will say this hotel shined was in it's customer service. We met an awesome man from the front desk that helped us with awesome restaurants, direction, and a lady from the kitchen even walked my boyfriend to the store one night when we wanted some wine. Their hospitality was impecable, and aside from the issues we had while we were there we had a great time and appreciated the friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, right on beach, definitely no frills”
Reviews.Author: cfromme
Reviews.Content: This was a good value and a good location if you want to soak up the sun and the waves. It's in a gated community, so you feel quite safe and the neighborhood is pretty quiet. The room was not exactly sparkling clean, but probably cleaner than my own home. There aren't a ton of dining choices within walking distance and the in house hotel is quite expensive except for the complimentary breakfast, which is very good. There was a lot of noise from the street in the early morning. The location is not too far from Old San Juan, but not within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice29
Reviews.Content: The rooms were dirty and bed small. Our airconditioner was broken. They finally moved us to another room--the balcony door didn't open and the tv didn't work. Sound travels through the paper thin walls (think screens without any glass panes to muffle any noise) making it impossible to sleep. Staff was rude (including the owner). Beach chairs are old and two that we took were broken. The wait staff never once came to take our orders for drinks on the beach. This place is WAY over-priced and even the pretty ocean view couldn't make up for all the negatives of this place. The food was ok--visit the restaurant here if you really want to (though there are WAY better places nearby) but definitely don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “horrible”
Reviews.Author: BruxellesLaura
Reviews.Content: One of the worst hotels for visiting San Juan Puerto Rico.Located in a poor neighbourhood , the area of the hotels there can be accessed through big iron doors , it's like a park ,and there are rangers proudly going up and down by car in that area.The hotel has only one asset, it ' sdirectly on the beach , only the rooms are old, small, dirty, stinky, full of unidentified bugs, our shower didn't work properly, the bath tube was super old and with traces of rust, the so called rooms with a sea view ( one of which we had) in fact give to the restaurant terrace, noise included obviously.The food of restaurant was ok, only we had to wait one hour until they brought us the drinks, lunch lasted 3 hours , so...Fortunately enough we only spent there one night on the way back to Europe from San Juan.For San Juan it's better to go for the safe choices like Convento or Caribe Hilton for instance, which we had chosen for the first week of our stay in Puerto Rico, the price was just the same.

Reviews.Title: “Good Service don't exist at Hosteria”
Reviews.Author: DoddyMary
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend for a couple of days to visit the island but I will never again get back there the service is terrible and the rooms looks really bad, I know that is cheap but the don't mean bad. The bedding smelled really bad liked they haven't washed in ages and the room had a really bad problem with the fungus. Puerto Rico is a great place to go and have a really nice vacations but not at Hosteria.

Reviews.Title: “Tacky in every sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: redlefgnid
Reviews.Content: We had to be careful not to touch doors or molding in our room, as the recently-lacquered wood had not dried. Additionally, the room had the ambiance of a hospital operating room, with sea foam green walls and a buzzing, square light fixture. It's located in a gated community adjacent to a fairly bad neighborhood. Be prepared to walk quite a distance for restaurants or anything other than sunbathing. Don't be fooled by the lush pictures on the internet, it's pretty plain in person -- and a bit pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A Two-star Guesthouse with a Great Location and Setting”
Reviews.Author: gdilieto
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at HosterÃ­a del Mar in a "Standard" Room and also saw another room in the same category. For the quality of accomodation I experienced, the Hotel - properly a Guesthouse - would not be worth staying if it wasn't for the setting and the beachfront location. My Standard Room - see photos posted - was barely decent, somewhat rundown and old. The bathroom had issues as well with water in the shower taking long time to get barely warm and the toilet flush working poorly. All in all, the Hotel sets itself at the bottom-end of the midrange accomodation, and if you are not open up to live with some discomfort, you can start looking at some place else right away. The reason why you may want to stay here is the setting: literally right on the beach in one of the prettiest areas of Ocean Park, where the high-rise condos leave way to more quite and cozy residential communities. If a cozy place at the beach is what you are after, this Hotel may be worth considering. There is a beautiful patio right on the beach where meals are served or where you can just relax during the day. The restaurant, serving "International Creative Cuisine", (that's how they say on their website), is good in quality but pricey, and it is a kind of funny after your dinner to move from a four-star restaurant to a two-star motel-like room. Service at the Hotel is generally poor and you shall not have any expectations in term of efficiency. The Continental breakfast included in the rate is also poor and any integration comes at extra price. Getting to the Hotel is not straightforward since it is hosted inside a gated community whose entrance is few blocks away the address street. If you are driving it may take you a while to figure out how to get there (entrance through Calle Santa Ana, take note) and, in my case, the front desk that I phoned was not much helpful in giving me directions. All in all, per my experience, this Hotel will please those ones looking for a cozy place at a beachfront location not much demanding about the quality of accomodation. If you are after a nice room or an attentive service, you shall look somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Poor communication”
Reviews.Author: welovetravel0
Reviews.Content: We tried to book a reservation twice at this hotel. We tried through their Web site and through gotopuertorico.com. We did not receive any confirmation that they got our inquiry and they didn't respond to e-mails, so we made arrangements elsewhere, but they charged us for not canceling the reservation. We eventually got our money back, but it was after a long hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: indytee
Reviews.Content: I went directly to the website to book this hotel. I should have thought twice when the site traveler's review page was under constuction. The hotel room was horrible. The showere head sqirted water all over the bathroom. The bedspread and rug was dirty and dingy. The bed had bed bugs. I left with lumps all over my legs. The food was too expensive but very good. Animals are allowed at this hotel. They dogs and other neighbors dogs used the beach as their toliet. I did not once step foot on that dirty beach. Overall i would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Spend the extra cash and get a room you'll enjoy even if it's for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: mthomas14
Reviews.Content: All in all, the location was excellent with the ocean no more than 10 yards from the hotel itself. The water was amazing allowing for swimming, and bogey boarding. The waves varied in size, and at times they were pretty big. The beach was great. Kids were building sand castles, while others were laying in the sun. The hotel itself was very nice. Of course there was sand throughout the hotel being right on the beach, but the staff did a great job keeping the building looking nice and tidy. Rooms that we stayed in were your standard hotel rooms complete with fridge. We also had a small porch overlooking the ocean and the restaurant patio. The bar in the Hosteria was a little pricey, but they made excellent pina coladas and other drinks. Also, the deserts were to good not to order them all (I recommend the sorbet). The hotel was located in an area called Ocean Park (Kind of a gated community from the rest of San Juan) which is about a 10 minute taxi ride from the cafes, shops, attractions & fort in Old San Juan. Be careful, though, I heard a story about a girl who was staying at the Hosteria while we were there: She decided to take a late night swim, and left her purse on the beach which was picked up by a passer-by. Ocean Park has its own security, but I wouldn't recommend leaving valuables on the beach at night ANYTIME. I had a great experience at the Hosteria Del Mar in San Juan, and I would recommend it to anyone. Great water, great location, great beach = Great Time!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it seems”
Reviews.Author: jmz0529
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn from April 30th to May 3rd 2008. It took forever to find the place. Once inside looked old and was greeted by a dirty carpet leading to our rooms, 106 & 103. Was told we had a ocean front room #106 and the door would open right on to the beach, however what they didn't say was the restaurant and bar had there tables right in front of those doors so everyone who "stopped by" the restaurant was sitting right outside our door until way past 11pm. We had no privacy at all !! The window in the bathroom did not close so you could hear all the talking and laughing in our room. We were interrupted by workmen who were repairing the phone in our room. Our free breakfast cost us $20.00 for coffee because we asked for seconds and were told they had to make it in the back? The free coffee ran out on the table in the restaurant as well as cups. The restaurant is very expensive to the point of being ridiculous for a Inn that has the appearance of looking old and worn. The service was so slow it took forever to get a cup of coffee in the morning. No electrical outlet in the bathroom, we had to unplug either the lamp by the bed or the lamp across the room to use the outlet for hairdryers or curling irons. Had to ask for the sheets to be changed on arrival because they had sand on them. While on the beach, several people came with their dogs who used the beach as a toilet for their dogs and then would kick sand over the mess their dog just made instead of picking it up. It seems like this is a everyday occurrence on the beach. Overall, way to expensive for what you got. Would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but that's all”
Reviews.Author: Dolenksy
Reviews.Content: Hosteria del Mar is beautifully situated on the beach and features a surf side indoor/outdoor restaurant that gets you about as close to the water as possible. However, if you're at all discriminating, beware that the apartments will disappoint you. Old, tired, dirtyish and without any views. Perhaps the regular rooms are better, I don't know. Also, beware the rollaway beds -- my son slept on the floor rather than on the old rollaway which was worn out but for which we still were charged. Lastly, cost is huge here. One night in our apartment plus one lunch and one dinner for five ran us $750 US. The "continental breakfast" is free, but is a joke. I had four rock hard green pear slices, dried out toast pieces and a small cake. My wife refused to eat her cake as there were clearly teeth marks in it. Ugh. Bottom line -- unless you really value a beach location be careful about this one.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Mellon_54
Reviews.Content: You must read the review 'awful' ? - It is absolutly correct ! We have been looking for a hotel in San Juan - for little money - near airport - at the beach. - And we got it !! So for us Hosteria Del Mar was a good choise and we had two wonderful days. You are looking for nice roms - good service - perfect entree - large bill ? - Take an other hotel !

Reviews.Title: “I had a great time at the Hosteria del Mar”
Reviews.Author: kilayeomi
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in Hosteria del Mar for nine days and it was a very pleasant experience. I did not get a beach front room but one in the second floor which was quiet and very clean and everything worked just perfectly. The room was recently painted and was quite spacious. For $80 per night and a comp breakfast it was the best deal I could get. Even some of the locals were amazed at the deal. The staff was very friendly and the lunch at the restaurant was fantastic, dinner prices were high. The hotel is located in a gated community and it is very safe and the beach is a local hangout for the local middle class young people during the weekends. There are free "Bomba" drum performances at the beach nearby on sunday afternoons, which is something not to be missed if you are interested in Puerto Rican Culture. You will need a car to move around and local transportation and shops are a few blocks away from the hotel, but the safety and location makes up for it. I strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return!”
Reviews.Author: qb20
Reviews.Content: When we were looking for a hotel in San Juan, the main thing we wanted was a beachfront location. That is what we got here at the Hosteria del Mar, but not much else. Yes, the lobby is nice, the restaurant is one of the best in the neighborhood (coincidentally, the most expensive), and the beachfront patio is awesome. However, if you are not in a room on the beach, it is not as great. Our rooms were very shabby. I say rooms because we had to change rooms after we checked in, due to a bookkeeping error, which was very annoying. Each of the bathrooms had problems - the first one wouldn't drain, and in the second one, the shower did not work. period. But by that time we were so exhausted and sick of the change we didn't feel like moving again. Also, the A/C isn't great, the rooms were very humid, and oh man! What mosquitos! I have never been so eaten up by bugs. Finally, the free wireless internet wasn't working. This hotel's only redeeming qualities were: 1) the free breakfast was a good start (fruit, toast, coffee cake, hot drinks, etc) 2) the people at the front desk, though incompetent most of the time, were very nice Needless to say, we will not be returning, and we will not recommend this to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience”
Reviews.Author: divan69
Reviews.Content: Made reservations three weeks in advance at the front desk for a weekend stay. The same day we arrived we were told our room was unavailable and they had relocated us at a private residence back patio apartment. The residence was about three blocks away from the hotel and a street over the beach front. Paying for a hotel room at a beachfront hotel is not the same as paying for a â€œserviceâ€� apartment, it was unacceptable. They should have called us as soon as they knew our reserved room was unavailable. No call, no decent accommodations, not even an offer for a rain-check. We were rudely dismissed without any concern.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice location, beach access, lovely restaurant!”
Reviews.Author: niederberger16
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and had a very enjoyable stay. The restaurant is wonderful...it makes you feel like you're on a tropical island from the tiki-style set-up of the area. The beach is literally a step outside the door and the view is also phenomenal of the ocean. The food is outstanding....a little on the expensive side, but well worth it! Our room was not an ocean front room, therefore it was a little stuffy. I would recommend an ocean front room if available. But everything is clean and in order. The receptionists are helpful, you just need to ask them. PARKING...make sure you ask the desk how to get in to park because the hotel is in a gated-in community (for safety, i presume). Once you find the gate, not hard, it is very easy to navigate yourself in the area. Literally, less than 10 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED Hosteria Del Mar & almost missed out due to poor reviews”
Reviews.Author: veggie4
Reviews.Content: I was going to stay at Hosteria Del mar but was scared off by bad reviews on Trip Advisor. The wonderful owner, Elsie, was sorry I cancelled and invited me to lunch, on the house, to see the place. I loved the beautiful and peaceful setting on the beach, as well as the large assortment of Puerto Rican vegetarian dishes. The place was so nice I switched my hotel and stayed there, even though it cost me a night's stay at the At Wind Chimes Inn (cute but small, claustrophobic courtyard hotel on a busy road) which wouldn't let me out of my reservation. I had a large room w/ an ocean view balcony and the staff was super friendly. I stayed there alone and was never bored since the staff really took me in. Very tranquil place and the restaurant is a favorite with locals who want good food in a quiet and romantic place overlooking the water. Clean rooms w/ plenty of hot water and the AC worked well. It's even dog-friendly! No complaints by me other thanTrip Advisor raters almost made me miss out! I'm supposed to be in San Juan on a cruise in March and will be sure to go have lunch, again, and say hi to my new friends at Hosteria Del Mar.

Reviews.Title: “Water problems are over...”
Reviews.Author: gasper
Reviews.Content: The water problems are over for this hotel my people! I believe they are making some renovations on the hotel. They have umbrellas on the beach, walls are painted I guest they are taking care of the complaints that were made before by many of us. I really love this hotel, is romantic, enchanting , quiet and only 10 minutes from the airport and San Juan. Also 5 minutes from night life at el condado. You must also eat at their restaurant called Uvva . The restaurant is delicious, especially the Grilled Filet Mignon and maybe add an apetizer like Hummus and Babaganous is also delicious. You will love to stay at this hotel! Especially for those looking for a private place to stay. The staff is welcoming and friendly. Well I hope you love it, I know I did!

Reviews.Title: “Modest Room at Reasonable Rate; Excellent Food, Staff, Location”
Reviews.Author: SemesterAtSea1997
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Hosteria Del Mar in early December of 2006. We were on a budget, and the price ($140/night) was lower than that of nearby hotels, so we booked a room for 3 nights. The hotel is located right on the beach in a quiet upscale residential neighborhood which is gated off from the rest of the city. I find that a little weird, but it did contribute to my general sense of safety in walking back from dinner in Condado, the metropolitan area. Hosteria del Mar is nowhere near Old San Juan, but you can take the A5 bus, or a cab. A few blocks from the hotel is a restaurant called Pinky's with a yoga studio upstairs, amazing smoothies and a good sense of humor. All very comfortable, safe and fun for alternative and/or gay travelers. Back to the hotel. The entrance, lobby and restaurant at Hosteria Del Mar are beautiful - just take a look at their website. You can sit at a table on the beach, on the deck, or in the restaurant for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or anytime in between, and no one will hurry you along. The room was modest, but perhaps what you'd expect for that price in that area-? We have no way to know, since this was our first visit to Puerto Rico. The room was on the street side, not the ocean side, because we were told that would be quieter, and it was. To get to it, we had to cross an open, roofless area between the ocean side building and the street side building, and that area, floored in cement, seemed a little grotty to me. Not dirty, but as if much less attention had been paid to how it looked than the other common areas of the hotel. The room itself was relatively small, very clean, painted light pink, with large cool white tiles on the floor, two windows right next to each other - about the size of a picture window - and somewhat bare walls. It had a queen-sized bed, one night table, a TV, a decent sized closet with a tall, skinny wicker bureau, and a small bathroom with a shower (no tub). My biggest complaint has to do with the fact that there was only one night table - I had to keep asking to have things passed to me, or just leave them on the floor on my side. And there was one evening where the water slowed down to a trickle, so that we had to put off our showers a few hours, until it returned. Oh - and the string for raising the large shade covering both windows wasn't there...we held it up with a coathanger so we could look out onto the beautiful tree right outside our window. At night, we fell asleep to the sound of tree frogs and birds - very peaceful. The food at the restaurant was delicious, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. If you are very picky and have the money to spend on a ritzy place, come here for lunch or dinner, not to stay. Or get one of the more expensive rooms - perhaps the staff has lavished more care on them, in terms of night tables, window shades, etc. If you aren't that particular, or you're on a budget, and the combination of perfection and small annoyances I've described sounds like it will suit you, definitely make a reservation. We had a wonderful time here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach inn with no water!”
Reviews.Author: HaneyGIS
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a nice patio, location, and staff. However, please beware that this hotel has a water problem. In our first room, there was only drops of water out of the shower. In our second room, we had none. They sent us to another room to shower and it was told to us and obvious that other hotel guest had been using the same room to shower. The managment didn't even offer to compensate us in any way. I was very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away. Read the review of this place. Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: EmilieV7
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were obliged to stay here for three nights because we were travelling with friends and they had made the reservations for us and for themselves. They have stayed here several times in the past and acknowledged that this hotel has seriously declined. Our room was actually filthy and smelled of mold. There is NO service to speak of from the front desk unless chilly grumpiness qualifies as service. We had to lug our bags up to our nasty tired room which they somehow called a suite. Though "suite" way over dignifies what this room is. Some sort of gritty gunk all over the bathroom, sandpapery sheets on the bed, hideous studenty furniture, barely a trickle of water in the bathroom and virtually no hot water. Then there was the food. Ick. And drinks at the bar. Ick again. Yuck. And the cost of this hotel is hideously overpriced. We had to pay around $240 a night for this dump. On a bright note: we love San Juan and look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Welcome to the Hotel Hosteria, you can check in but you can never check out!”
Reviews.Author: mgnasty
Reviews.Content: We spent four days at this Hotel, and that's only because we were with a wedding party. We were ready to leave after the first night, but couldn't since when you book the room, you are obligated to PAY for the days booked, with no alternative to cancel. (This doesn't even sound LEGAL!) We had a VERY SMALL room overlooking the Caribbean Sea, but COULDN'T OPEN THE BLINDS/SHADES to enjoy the sunshine or the view! When we complained about this we were ignored. The staff does it's best to clean the rooms and the beach is maintained quite well, but we experienced power outages and the showers were barely a trickle of tepid water. I would NOT recommend this place to my worst enemy. Avoid this hotel at all costs! Pay the extra $$ and enjoy your stay in San Juan, which is actually quite an accommodating city in P.R. I wish I had viewed this site before booking this room. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Hosteria This Time Arounnd”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been a world traveller on a budget for many years, so I've sampled more than a few bed and breakfasts, etc. In addition I've been staying in the Ocean Park area of San Juan for close to thrity years. I recently chose Hosteria on the basis of a one night stop-over five years ago, and was charmed by the warm wood and rattan interior and the delightful late-night staff. I must say that this particular stay was a disappointing one. The rooms (we stayed there on two different occasions as stop-overs to and from Culebra) were greatly in need of painting. They were not really clean--gritty-floor syndrome. The Ocean Park beach has declined in cleanliness to the point of un-usability! Not the fault of Hosteria, to be sure, but a problem nonetheless. The night staff were delightful, but the day staff tended to be on the grumpy side. The breakfasts were terrible! No fruit, over-cooked coffee, tough eating out on their wooden deck is still a joy. Go to Kasalta on McLeary for somne edible morning fare. Finally, the rooms are greatly over-priced for what they are. $250. per night can almost get you a roomn at the Normandie, if that's your cup of tea (...and why not?) Numero Uno down the beach a few blocks is a much better deal, believe me! One big compliment: I left some clothes in the closet en route to Culebra and they had them for me when I returned. That counts for a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's sad - this was obviously a terrific hotel... once. The carved wood of the entrance and dining room is beautiful, the sand just outside the door is soft and inviting, the expensive restaurant serves still-excellent food. Past the lobby and dining rooms, however, buyer beware. The hotel is dying fast from a complete lack of adult supervision. The staff is made up of pretty 20-somethings, more intent on comparing tongue studs and tattoos than actually serving hotel guests. After we arrived, the indifferent teenager at the front desk gave us the key to our room and let us haul our own bags upstairs. When we opened the door, we found... other peoples' clothes and things strewn about. Oops! Back to the front desk, where the hapless clerk scratched his head for awhile before drifting upstairs to see what he could do about the situation. Twenty minutes and one very hasty clean-up job later we were again given the keys to the same room. This time it was empty, although we found a pair of sneakers under one bed and the pillows on the other bed still smelled of someone else's cologne. Oh well, too late to fuss over details -- our two small children and we settled down to sleep, after setting the alarm for the 6am wake-up we'd need to make our plane the next day. We were all sprawled half-naked and deep asleep on our beds when the locks on the door started rattling at about 1am. My husband just had time to spring up and grab the door before the couple who thought they were still staying in the room opened it with their key. Seems the front desk had forgotten to tell them about the change. Confusion ensued. But don't get the impression that this one incident has prompted me to write a disgruntled review. We were in the hotel for a couple of nights one week before this incident, and the problem was the same: clueless staff, absent management. The first impression is great, but the longer you stay the more you notice how bad things are. That lovely soft sand outside the door? Full of cigarette butts and people's discarded napkins and lemon rinds, cause the hotel staff can't be bothered to give it a quick rake every morning. The delicious though expensive restaurant? In the morning, guests are treated to a "continental breakfast" of coffee in styrofoam cups, individual boxes of Frosted Flakes, and red delicious apples. And yes, the carved wood downstairs is beautiful -- but those shiny poly bed covers and foam pillows upstairs are kinda hard to square with the hotel's upscale rates. I don't recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, compromise...”
Reviews.Author: cpworsham
Reviews.Content: This place reminds me of going to visit poor relatives in a 3rd world country. You really get the feeling they are trying their best but with limited means. It's not a bad place to stay: The facilities and rooms were immaculately clean, the staff was very welcoming, friendly, attentive, and courteous. The hotel definately has its merits. A nice waterfall feature greets arriving visitors. For me and others used to traveling in 4-star and above hotels, however there might be some disappointments. There was no alarm clock in the room, but the staff was able to program an early morning wake up call. The rooms do not come with coffee makers (a trip down stairs staff gave me a cup), hair dryers, face(wash) cloths (available upon request), refrigerators (some units have kitchenettes), the floors are terra cotta tile with only one small rug, the towels were worn and a little threadbare. I really wasn't all that thrilled about the so-called "complimentary continetal breakfast." I got there half way through it at 9am (the hours are 8 to 10) there was nothing to eat but bread, cereal (with no milk or bowls!), and bananas. They also ran out of coffee. The reason might have been that the morning I was having breakfast they seemed short-staffed so service was a bit sluggish. I returned later to try to dinner menu and was not disappointed. The prices seem reasonable for a fine meal ($25-30pp) in a major metropolitan area. No problems with the service or the presentation, the tip is included in the price. This is one of the finer restaurants in the area that seems to be frequented by the locals and tourist from this (and other hotels) hotel alike. The area was safe, gated community. I parked the rental car close and on the street. A plus for me was that they have wireless internet access in the lobby. Having it in the rooms with a desk of some sort would have been better but all things considered it seems they at least are trying (3rd world country) so one wouldn't want to complain because it is lucky to have access at all. Finally, as affordabilty goes, during "high" season, the rate that I was quoted ($209 plus tax) is probably in the lower third of prices for places that I shopped (lowest was $180 and highest was $400+). I also want to mention as an aside that there is a great bakery/restaurant right outside the main gate but to the left where many locals go for typical dishes and great food at reasonable prices. I always go there to get their ensalada de pulpo (Octopus salad) when I am in San Juan.

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Service & Beware First Floor 'ocean view' rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Year's and paid a highly inflated price for a so-called ocean view room with patio. In fact, the tiny cramped room had a view of the ocean but overlooked a 'patio' at which diners (smoking) were served meals. Avoid these rooms at all costs. We were then moved at a higher price to an apartment in the back. The air conditioning did not work, lights did not work, neither tv contol worked and while the management tried to address at least some of the issues, they did not succeed. Worst of all was the restaurant. The prices were way too high for decent but not great food and the worst service we've ever experienced. We were kept waiting a half hour after the reservation and served everything, if at all, horribly slowly. At one point, the so-called server came out to tell us that she had now had her dinner and let's see did you get your entrees (we had not). She asked for our dessert orders early to reserve what we wanted. Later, much later, when she brought them out they were all that was left and nothing that we had ordered. The 15% fixed price tip was ultimately settled downward but we can't recommend this restaurant or for that matter the hotel even though the location on a nice if somewhat windy beach was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Bad value...at inflated holiday rates”
Reviews.Author: kiwi400
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 7 nights during the New Year's Holiday. Staff could be friendly but not consistantly..... food good in restaurant but breakfast was skimpy and awful- as if they were holding back so they could save on costs. At Christmas we were paying over $300 a night for two rooms. Street was VERY LOUD - YOU MUST ASK TO SAY AWAY FROM THE STREET (over the entrance). A car alarm went off all night and they refused to call the police to do somethign about it. They refused to accept that the car was owned by a guest. It turns out the car was owned by a guest, who the next day heard about the problem was very non-chalant. The rooms were tired but clean - but not that comfortable. Beach was right there but wasn't that nice. It is a long drive to Old Town. This is how disappointed I was...I was there 11 months ago...I'm writing today.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay there. Very nice place to stay...VERY CLEAN and friendly staff.....excellent location..!!!!!!!! Go and try it....you won't regreat it...
